articles.title: U.S. Nuclear-Powered Carrier Flotilla Enters Pusan Port
articles.content:
U.S. Nuclear-Powered Carrier Flotilla Enters Pusan Port 
    Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- A U.S. nuclear-powered carrier flotilla consisting of Enterprise, Aegis destroyer, cruiser, submarine, etc. entered Pusan port of south Korea on July 18, according to press reports.
 The flotilla has been involved in the large-scale RIMPAC-2006 joint military exercises simulating a war of aggression against the DPRK.  This portcall is stirring up the deep concern of the public at home and abroad as it fully revealed the intention of the U.S. imperialists to further strain the situation on the Korean Peninsula and thus realize their ambition to start a nuclear war.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on Self-reliant Defense Capacity
Message of Sympathy to Indonesian President
articles.content:
Message of Sympathy to Indonesian President 
    Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on July 19 sent a message of sympathy to Susilo Bambang Yudhoyono, president of Indonesia, in connection with earthquake-caused tsunami that hit Indonesia, claiming huge human and material losses.
 The message extended profound sympathy and consolation to the Indonesian president and, through him, to the victims and residents in the afflicted-area.    
 The message expressed the belief that the aftermath of the natural disasters would be healed as early as possible and the living of the residents in the afflicted-area would be stabilized by the efforts of the president and the Indonesian government.

articles.title: DPRK to Strongly React to U.S. Moves for War against it with Deterrent for Self-Defence
Greetings to Belgian King
articles.content:
Greetings to Belgian King 
    Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Friday sent a message of greetings to Albert II, king of Belgium, on its national day.
 The message wished the Belgian people progress and prosperity.

articles.title: Greetings to Belgian Foreign Minister
articles.content:
Greetings to Belgian Foreign Minister 
    Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun sent a message of greetings to Belgian Foreign Minister Louis Michel on the occasion of its national day.
 The message expressed hope that the relations between the two countries would further develop in the future.

articles.title: Hanchongryon Vows to Become Vanguard of Reunification
articles.content:
Hanchongryon Vows to Become Vanguard of Reunification 
    Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- The chairman of the south Korean Federation of University Student Councils (Hanchongryon) reportedly made public an appeal on July 5, calling for staging an all-out struggle for peace against the U.S. and war under the banner of "By our nation itself."
 The appeal said that the U.S. and south Korean anti-reunification forces are all the more undisguised in their moves to keep the Korean nation divided at a time when its desire to achieve independent reunification, peace against war and great national unity is mounting under the banner of the June 15 joint declaration.    
 The reality prevailing on the Korean Peninsula requires the Korean nation to stage a vigorous patriotic movement for independent reunification, peace against war and great national unity under the banner of "By our nation itself," the appeal said.   It called upon Hanchongryon to become vanguard of reunification and display stubbornness and ability.
